record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 5, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 5, 2007 -- (Senate - September 04, 2007)

[Page: S11081]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m. Wednesday, September 5; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business until 11:30 a.m. with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each and that the time be equally divided and controlled between the leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the majority controlling the final portion, and that during the majority's time, Senator Dorgan be recognized

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
